questions.question: Choose the word that means "not reversible":
questions.explanation: "Ir-" is used before words starting with 'r' and means "not," so "irreversible" means not able to be reversed.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: To "___lodge" means to remove or force out from a position. (Im / Dis)
questions.explanation: "Dis-" means "away" or "apart," so "dislodge" means to force out of a place.

questions.question: Which word means "to reveal information"?
questions.explanation: While "dis-" often means "not" or "reverse," in this case, it means "away" or "apart." "Disclose" means to reveal or make known.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: "___audible" describes a sound that cannot be heard. (im / in)
questions.explanation: "In-" means "not," so "inaudible" means not able to be heard.

questions.question: Select the word that means "not capable of being corrupted":
questions.explanation: "In-" means "not," so "incorruptible" means not able to be corrupted.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: An "___partial" judge shows no favouritism. (in / im)
questions.explanation: "Im-" means "not," so "impartial" means not partial or biased.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: To "___arm" means to take away weapons. (sub / dis)
questions.explanation: "Dis-" means "remove," so "disarm" means to remove arms or weapons.

questions.question: Select the word that means "not capable of being measured":
questions.explanation: "Im-" means "not," and it's used before words starting with 'm'. "Immeasurable" means not able to be measured.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: An "___mature" fruit is not yet ripe. (in / im)
questions.explanation: "Im-" means "not," so "immature" means not fully developed or ripe.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: "___marine" life exists below the surface of the sea. (sub / dis)
questions.explanation: "Sub-" means "under," so "submarine" means under the sea.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: "___rational" behaviour is not based on reason or logic. (In / Ir)
questions.explanation: "Ir-" means "not," so "irrational" means not rational or logical.

questions.question: Which word means "not following the usual rules"?
questions.explanation: "Ir-" is used before words starting with 'r' and means "not," so "irregular" means not regular or not following usual rules.

questions.question: Which word means "to prove false or wrong"? (Disprove / Improve)
questions.explanation: "Dis-" means "not" or "opposite of," so "disprove" means to prove something is not true.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: To "___qualify" means to make ineligible. (dis / sub)
questions.explanation: "Dis-" means "not" or "opposite of," so "disqualify" means to make not qualified.

questions.question: Select the word that means "less effective":
questions.explanation: This means "not effective" or "not producing the desired effect." It doesn't mean "less effective," but rather "not effective at all."

questions.question: Fill in the blank: An "___possible" task cannot be done. (in / im)
questions.explanation: "Im-" means "not," so "impossible" means not possible or unable to be done.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: A "___tropical" climate is nearly tropical but cooler. (im / sub)
questions.explanation: "Sub-" means "under" or "nearly," so "subtropical" means nearly tropical.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: To "___assemble" means to take apart. (dis / ir)
questions.explanation: "Dis-" means "apart," so "disassemble" means to take apart or separate into pieces.

questions.question: Select the word that means "not capable of being disputed":
questions.explanation: "In-" means "not," so "indisputable" means not able to be disputed.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: "___mobile" objects cannot move or be moved easily. (in / im)
questions.explanation: "Im-" means "not," so "immobile" means not mobile or unable to move.

questions.question: Which word means "to remove from power or authority"?
questions.explanation: "Dis-" (which becomes "de-" in this case) means "remove" or "reverse," so "dethrone" means to remove from power.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: To "___agree" means to have a different opinion.
questions.explanation: "Dis-" means "not" or "opposite of," so "disagree" means to not agree.

questions.question: Choose the word that means "to break into parts":
questions.explanation: "Dis-" means "apart" or "away," so "disintegrate" means to break apart into pieces.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: "___personal" communication lacks warmth or emotion.
questions.explanation: "Im-" means "not," so "impersonal" means not personal or lacking individual connection.

questions.question: Fill in the blank: To "___connect" means to separate.
questions.explanation: "Dis-" means "apart" or "away," so "disconnect" means to separate or detach.
